description: carved wood cylinder with two protruding flat wooden pieces on either side; woven rope wound around base of one of wooden pieces; two square-shaped openings on top with a slit in between openings; raised carvings of linear shapes and looping edges along top; dark brown patina; shipped with mountt
text: Like the abstract animal-shaped slit gong nearby, this instrument is a so-called “talking drum.” In this case, the carver has made it look like a human face: the slit represents a “mouth,” terminating in “eyes,” which are highlighted by semi-circles. The instrument’s surface shows a beautiful deep gloss, called patina, that is produced by extensive use and age. It was handled for decades by people who had been initiated into a society or association with great political power and prestige among the Ndengese people.
title: Slit gong
